title: Paris F.C. Set Tickets To $0. Should Others Do the Same?
excerpt: When Paris F.C. made its tickets free, it began an experiment into the connection between fans and teams, and posed a question about the value of big crowds to televised sports.

title: What’s Behind the Exploding Prices of Pro Sports Franchises?
excerpt: Teams were once considered poor, unpredictable investments. Today they’re among the most coveted assets in the world. What changed?

title: America’s favorite family outings are increasingly out of reach
excerpt: Taking the kids to a baseball game, a movie, or Disneyland is a bigger financial commitment than it used to be for middle-class families.

title: West Virginia-Pitt’s renewed Backyard Brawl a reminder of toll realignment
excerpt: "For your fans, what’s important to them?” said West Virginia athletic director Shane Lyons of scheduling rivals after realignment.

title: The LA Rams are winners in football. They’re ‘loss leaders’ in economics
Consuming Contests: The Effect of Outcome Uncertainty on Spectator Attendance in the Australian Football League
excerpt: Contests that non-contestants consume for entertainment are a fixture of economic, cultural and political life. We exploit injury-induced changes to teams’ line
